page.title: 19St. Michaels, Catwick
page.content: {St. Michaels Church,}Catwick is built of cobbles infilled with bricks. We looked at the porch, which has two wooden doors to keep the heat in. The church was given Â£25 to build 17 new seats for the poor people . The rich people sat facing the{pulpit}but the poor people sat at the side. The{organ}was very small. The altar had a white cloth and a blue cloth. Near the{altar}were two graves; they were slabs of concrete one was of the old Rector. The{font}has an octogonal shaped wooden lid with eagles on top. The oldest grave is 201 years old; the youngest person buried is 2 months. The{vestry}is at one of the sides where the poor people sit. The{choir stalls}have decorated ends so do the seats where the rich people sat.Sarah Waudby,Sarah Lister{Leven CE
